title-group.article-title: Correction to “Concurrent decreases in the prevalence of wheezing and Ascaris infection among 5‐year‐old children in rural Bangladesh and their regulatory T cell immunity after the implementation of a national deworming program”

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2023 The Authors. Immunity, Inflammation and Disease published by John Wiley & Sons Ltd.

license.license-p: This is an open access article under the terms of the http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ License, which permits use, distribution and reproduction in any medium, provided the original work is properly cited.

body.p: In Takeuchi et al., 1 the Acknowledgements and Funding statements are incorrect and should be corrected.

ack.title: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
ack.p: This work was funded by a Grant‐in‐Aid for Scientific Research 26257507 (Basic Research [A]) in 2014‐2016 from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology, Japan. icddr,b thanks the governments of Bangladesh, Canada, Sweden, and the UK for providing core/unrestricted support. The authors thank the children who participated in our studies and offered us their precious blood and stool, and their guardians who accompanied them. We also thank the field research staffs for their rigorous data collection.

ack.title: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
ack.p: The International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh (icddr,b) would like to acknowledge the contribution of the core donors of the icddr,b: the governments of Bangladesh, Canada, Sweden, and the United Kingdom.

The authors would like to express their gratitude to all of the children who participated in the present study and their guardians who accompanied them. The authors would also like to thank the field research staff and Dr. Ipshita Hamid Trisha for their involvement in the data collection of the present study 1 . Furthermore, the authors would like to express their gratitude to all the children who had participated in a previous related study and their guardians who had accompanied them. The authors would also like to thank the field research staff, Dr Tariq Anwar, and Dr J. Chakraborty for their involvement in the data collection of the previous study. Moreover, the authors are grateful to Dr Khaleq Zaman, Dr Junkichi Takahashi, Dr Md Yunus, Dr Hafizur Rahman Chowdhury, Dr Shams EL Arifeen, Dr Abdullah Baqui, and Professor Susumu Wakai for their involvement in creating the dataset referred to in the present study, which enabled the completion of the present study1. Finally, the authors acknowledge the overall support from Professor Yukiko Wagatsuma, Dr Mahbubur Rahman, Professor David Sack, and Professor Kanehisa Morimoto.
Grant‐in‐Aid for Scientific Research 26257507 (Basic Research (A)) in 2014–2016 from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology, Japan. Grant/Award Number: 26257507
The correct Funding statement should be:
Grant‐in‐Aid for Scientific Research (A) for the FY2014–FY2016 from Japan Society for the Promotion of Science 26257507, and the International Community Health Research Fund

ref.mixed-citation: Takeuchi, H , Khan MA , Ahmad SM , et al. Concurrent decreases in the prevalence of wheezing and Ascaris infection among 5‐year‐old children in rural Bangladesh and their regulatory T cell immunity after the implementation of a national deworming program. Immun Inflamm Dis. 2019;7:160‐169. 10.1002/iid3.253 31256445
